newsitem.title: USA: MHC says Chateau bid worth $400 mln.
newsitem.headline: MHC says Chateau bid worth $400 mln.

text.p: Manufactured Home Communities said on Wednesday that its cash tender for Chateau Properties Inc is worth nearly $400 million.
According to MHC, Chateau has 6.1 million common shares outstanding, 8.75 million operating partnership units and 482,000 stock options. The total is 15.332 million.
MHC renewed its all-cash offer of $26 per Chateau share, valued at $398.63 million.
Last month, MHC also offered the option of 1.15 MHC shares per Chateau share or unit, a proposal with a value of $326.19 million based on MHC's share price Wednesday of 18-1/2.
Sun Communities Inc offered 0.892 Sun share for each Chateau share, or OP unit. Using the same criteria, the deal is worth $386.35 million based on Wednesday's Sun share price of 28-1/4.

In July, ROC Communities Inc and Chateau agreed to merge and form another company. Chateau shareholders were to receive one share of the new company. That deal was worth $404.38 million based on Chateau's price on Wednesday of 26-3/8.
Chateau could not be reached for comment.
